article_title: Arlington Woman Dies Before Crashing Vehicle
article_text:
Arlington, SD

An Arlington woman has died following a crash Friday night, but authorities say her death was not a result of the accident itself.

Around 8:30 p.m. Friday, 71-year-old Barbara Hudy was traveling near the intersection of US Highway 81 and Main Street in Arlington when her vehicle drifted to the right and off the road. The car drove through a yard, passed through several trees and finally struck an electric box.

Hudy was pronounced dead at the scene. South Dakota Highway Patrol says a coroner's investigation into her death ruled that she passed from a medical issue, and not from the crash itself. No one was else was hurt in the accident.
